Dyson is a global technology company. We examine what currently exists and question it. We take things apart and look at them from new angles. We reinvent things that should simply work better. The Machine Learning team works across all product categories at Dyson, alongside leading technical specialists and highly motivated creative people to develop products which challenge convention. We are expanding our research capability in Singapore and are currently looking for specialists in machine learning and artificial intelligence specialists to join our team, at all levels.

Accountabilities
Lead and inspire scientists, designers and research engineers to provide analytic insight into Dyson’s research challenges and support to operational issues.
Operate at the cutting edge of machine learning, developing novel techniques and furthering the state-of-the-art.
Act as a subject matter expert in the application of machine learning techniques to extract meaning and derive value from data collected from Dyson’s many product categories.
Perform investigatory analysis of large multivariate datasets, suggesting novel techniques for data collection during future experiments and field trials.
Identify opportunities to apply machine learning techniques to extract meaning and derive value.
Characterise classifier or algorithm performance against defined project objectives; proposed implementation environment; and associated computational constraints.
Collaborate with research engineers to recommend improvements to data collection and experimental strategy to optimise system performance.
Application of statistical methods to establish confidence in findings.
Design and develop clean, documented, and easy to maintain code. Integrate software builds with the corporate CI environment where appropriate.
Produce reports and presentations summarising progress against team and project goals, effectively and engagingly presenting complex technical information and analysis to senior and Executive level management.
Work independently to manage tasks with competing priorities.
Collaborate with academic and industrial partnerships to leverage externally available expertise, managing the relationship where appropriate.
Generation of novel intellectual property.
Skills
Doctoral degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Mathematics with industrial significant experience.
Expert knowledge of machine learning algorithm development and implementation in complex systems including hardware, software application and cloud-based components.
Demonstrable machine learning or data science experience with a proven track record outside of academia, ideally working with Agile development methodologies.
Feature extraction, time series analysis, signal processing, and statistical modelling.
Ability to program in both high and low-level languages as appropriate, including Java, Python, C, C++ and in Matlab.
Experience applying machine learning and data analysis techniques against real-world problems is essential.
Familiarity with CFD and simulation toolsets such as Ansys and OpenFoam would be desirable.
Enthusiasm to learn and share new methods and techniques within several areas of technical expertise.
Passionate about the technical and personal development of junior team members.
Benefits
Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.

Job Description

The Program Manager, Learning and Development will be responsible for growing, developing, motivating, and retaining talent to maximize their full potential, studio engagement and overall Ubisoft experience. The role focuses on driving learning initiatives and programs to onboard new talent, grow skillsets, develop leaders, and foster an inspiring culture that enables people to have the best employment journey.

Assess relevant training needs in consultation with key stakeholders including assessment methods, measurement and implementation of the relevant programs

Position Purpose & Summary

Cargill Trade & Capital Markets (TCM) was established in 1993 with the objective to create additional value for Cargill and its customers in the emerging markets. TCM works with customers and Cargill's commercial business units to provide financial solutions. TCM’s structuring expertise aids in mitigating documentary, cross-border and credit risks associated with trade finance.

In addition to meeting Cargill’s own trade finance and trade related funding needs, TCM also optimizes Cargill's physical trade flows to generate trade finance derived liquidity in emerging markets for customers. TCM is also engaged in risk management involving proprietary trading of financial products, foreign exchange, credit and money markets.

The Risk and Financial Analyst provides analytical and technical support to the business and its leadership team. The candidate will be responsible for producing analysis using accounting and risk data that would enable senior management to monitor and make decisions.

Working with the senior analyst, the individual will be exposed to a variety of projects and will be empowered to spearhead efforts to improve analysis for decision- making and business processes. These projects will often involve working closely with global finance, risk and operations teams, partnering them to shaping and influencing work and processes, with the aim of helping the business be more efficient and effective.

The individual should be a self-starter and curious – seeking to understand things and improve them, and culturally sensitive in his/her approach. Resourcefulness, persistence, attention to detail and creativity will also be key strengths that will enable the individual to be successful in creating solutions in the changing business environment, in spite of limited time and resources.


Principal Accountabilities

Analysis (40%)

Create and publish quarterly risk and financial snapshot of the business by analyzing the data received from our ERP (Findur), our General Ledger (SAP S4/HANA), excel based risk reports and financial data from FC10 (Cartesis)
Develop /improve report methodologies and dashboards to better reflect changing business context, in co-ordination with global risk and finance teams
Benchmarking business performance and forecasting opportunities and risks using a blend of internal and external data (Bloomberg, public data available on the internet, data collected during the credit review process etc)

Data and Process Development and Improvements (45%)

Prompt and accurate identification of data issues such as validating and cleansing the data, hypothesis-test root causes and working with multiple stakeholders to craft solutions
Improve data quality and create new means to how data can be systematically captured to enable efficient and sustainable reporting by using excel, VBA macros, python and SQL to mange and manipulate dat and using softwares like Alteryx, Tableau, and Power BI to analyze and report on the data
Explore new market instruments/ technology / methodologies to see if there can be improvements to current business choices / processes

Business Partnering (15%)

Translating business requirements into actionable points from systems, data and reporting perspectives
Ad-hoc projects and initiatives from business leaders and managers
Qualifications

Required Qualifications

A technical background, preferably in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data science or Computer science
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience, with at least 2 years in analytics and/or as a data analyst
Proven ability to work with Excel, VBA Macros, Python and SQL for data analysis
Ability to break down complex problems, think conceptually and seek/create new solutions
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Curiosity and eagerness to learn and improve, a resourceful self starter that follows through and delivers tasks. A team player who is not afraid of digging deep into the details.
Meticulous and highly numerate, with demonstrated ability to deliver under pressure
Excellent organizational skills with ability to perform well under pressure and manage multiple priorities
Comfortable working in a less structured environment

Preferred Qualifications

A technical background, preferably in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data science or Computer science
Project management and stakeholder management skills desired
Building workflows, tables and reports using Alteryx, Tableau and Power BI
Understanding of accounting and finance concepts
Understanding of credit and market risk concepts

Other Information

Career Development: As this position will have opportunities to work with senior leaders of several functions in different countries, it offers a unique platform to exhibit the individual’s skills and potential. High visibility, wide reach of projects, together with the interaction with multiple teams also creates an environment where the individual will be able to hone their leadership and problem-solving skills while showcasing it to a large audience.

Job Summary

Responsibilities:
Manage and execute all scheduled inventory counts in a timely manner from warehouse to store and vice versa ; Investigate any inventory discrepancies, reconcile all inventory report
Process and verify inventory receipts and compare through system to validate for accuracy, note discrepancies with distribution center (DFC) or appropriate carrier
Enhance overall operational efficiencies in store by implementing new processes, managing productivity rates, and maintaining an organized-efficient environment for customers and employees
Assist and maintain in all areas of customer pick up and drop off orders
Act as liaison with HQ to build understanding on day to day retail operations and opportunities for efficiency improvements to ensure store productivity and compliance
Meet and interact with customers; demonstrate an enthusiastic and positive attitude while adhering to company policies and procedures
Work with different teams including customer experience, product and tech teams to ensure successful build out of needed features
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree with strong academic records from top institutions
Strong analytical skills and data-driven; comfortable analyzing and making decision based on numbers
Proficient in using Microsoft Excel. Basic Microsoft office skills are required
Take ownership, with great organizational skills and well follow through on tasks
Enthusiastic, can-do attitude. Willing to be flexible and take on challenging tasks
Team-working skills. Have ability to work cross-functionally and interact with internal and external partners
Fast learner and be comfortable working in a fast-changing startup environment
Excellent communication skills in English

Job Description

As a Data Scientist for Ranking and Recommendations you will apply machine learning techniques such as collaborative filtering, reinforcement learning, and learning-to-rank to solve the quests of relevance prediction.

On a typical day, you will:
build systems that delight millions of travellers,
work on complex, yet fun user problems that require a mix of latest technologies,
work together with the Data Analytics across Traveloka business units to analyze exciting behavioral data,
build and tune machine learning models to improve recommendations and rankings,
use Traveloka’s experimentation platform to track and measure your models’ success,
effectively communicate with your teammates and peers, and
be a valued voice in our effort to constantly improve our practices and frameworks.
You will own data products such as:
Hotel recommendations using matrix-factorisation, SVD, or ALS
Car rental search ranking using LambdaMART, AdaRank, SVM-NDCG, or multinomial logistic regression
Restaurant and dish recommendation using content-based filtering or pattern mining techniques such as Apriori or association rules
Working in Traveloka:
You will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background.
We work in an open environment where there are no boundaries or power distance.
Everyone is encouraged to speak their mind, propose ideas, influence others, and continuously grow themselves.
Get the exposure to multi-aspect, collaborative, intensive startup experience with our recent expansion into Southeast Asia and exploration of new products.

Qualifications

Required Academic Qualifications
Masters/PhD degree from a top university in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or similar), or equivalent experience
Very good theoretical understanding of relevant statistical models, their inner workings, assumptions, and limitations
Very good understanding of evaluation metrics for relevance ranking, regression, and classification
Required Hands-On Experience
2+ years industry experience building recommender/ranking systems for a consumer-facing company
Strong hands-on experience in the ML life-cycle for data scientists (training, testing, tuning, and performance monitoring)
Experience with shuffling around data in cloud environments (preferably on GCP, including BigQuery, PubSub, Dataproc) and performing the data munging required for finding new opportunities in our data.

Maintain in-depth awareness of potential legislative and UBS policy breaches and act to proactively prevent their occurrence.Responsible for life cycle of client information by reviewing account documentation & maintaining static data and ensuring the accuracy and completeness of all sourced data.Direct liaison with; and support to internal clients through hotline/advisory support. Business partners includes but not limited to within operations, Legal and Compliance, Business Risk Management, Project team(s).Engage in adhoc project(s) including systems change, process improvement, cross-border initiatives, new regulatory changes from requirements gathering through to implementation.
Your team
You’ll be working in Singapore Wealth Management Operations. This team offers Client Due Diligence Review for new and existing clients, supporting both Singapore and Hong Kong business.
Your expertise
You have:
2-6 years of experience in Wealth Management Onboarding, Client Lifecycle Maintenance or related Operations roles. Working knowledge of Hong Kong and/or Singapore regulatory landscape favored.Client focused and motivated to work in partnership with front to back stakeholders to define practical solutions that meets the internal policies and regulatory requirementsStrong risk and control mindset with a structured and logical approach to analysis and problem-solving.
You are:
Client service oriented and enjoys working in a team.High motivation and positive can-do attitude. Effective & clear communication; comfortable in facing different stakeholders at senior levels.Adaptable to a dynamic and changing environment.
Your colleagues
About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

The position

You will play a key role on a high profile implementation. As a Senior Business Consultant, you will develop and execute implementation plans within a client's environment. The role contributes to all aspects of the delivery of SimCorp Dimensions, including design, configuration, integration, training and standard solutions. You will also be expected to take an active role in the ABOR service lines to improve implementation expertise and know-how of relevant consultants within SimCorp Asia. You will act as an important sparring partner for your clients and proactively manage, coordinate, and escalate issues as needed.


Key responsibilities
As a Senior Business Consultant, you will:
Participate in all aspects of SimCorp Dimension implementations, including design, configuration, integration, and test.Facilitate requirements gathering workshops in business-related areas.Document client requirements and map to SimCorp Dimension functions and processes, identifying process improvements and efficiencies where possible.Design and deliver an overall solution set to meet client requirements, modelling operational workflows around SimCorp Dimension, customizing and delivering standard configuration solutions, and developing and delivering new solutions.Customize the standard data conversion tools to meet client requirements to facilitate the conversion of portfolio and security master data, position data, historical performance, etc.Assist the client in development an overall test strategy and test plans and support the client in the execution of test cases, troubleshooting and resolving issues as they arise.Provide configuration and end-user training, allowing the client to maintain SimCorp Dimension and optimize its usage.Constantly expanding your knowledge of SimCorp Dimension and the clients' business in order to ensure that clients get the optimal configuration and workflow.Continuously identify ABOR market trends and competitive intelligence in the service line.Act as a mentor and coach to less experienced colleagues.


Your qualifications
Your excellent communication, coordination and interpersonal skills will help you lead all activities to success. You are a successful and strong profile in your current position as a highly regarded experienced consultant and are ready take the next step to stretch yourself professionally and personally. As our preferred candidate, you will have:
Degree/master's within Finance, Economics, Physics, Math, Science or Engineering.Minimum of 8 to 10 years of relevant experience in the Financial Industry.Consultants should have experience with multiple enterprise implementations involving ABOR functions on the buy side.Several years of experience designing and implementing SimCorp Dimension, covering those following topics:
o Investment Accounting
o General Ledger
o FAP / FAM configuration
o Portfolio structures
You are result driven, creative, and analytical with a global perspective.You have excellent communication skills and proficiency in English.Ability to speak Korean will be advantageous.


Interested?
If you are interested in the role, please apply!

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

As a Senior Programmer Analyst within the Equity Derivatives Data & Analytics Group you will be involved in one of the most significant platform changes within the Equities business. The team is critical to the success of this program and has responsibility for all of the market data being used by the Equity Derivatives systems.
The successful candidate will be key member of the team building out the new platform and migrating existing functionality, data validation and data between the existing and new platforms.
The candidate will be required to work with the front office, quants as well as counterparts in the middle office, managing requirements and work-loads across the relevant clients.

Experience with SonarCube.
Experience of Python
Multi-threading
Distributed Application Development
Experience of NoSQL data stores

About Spuul
Spuul is a Singapore based Over the Top (OTT) video streaming service, targeted at the South Asian market and the South Asian diaspora. We take entertainment very seriously, and we’re looking for someone who can identify problems and then help us solve them, in order to deliver unlimited, quality entertainment to our ~12 million users across the globe.

About The Team
We’re about 40 of us across three locations working hard to make sure we’re always ahead of the game. At Spuul, it’s never ‘just a job’ and life doesn’t end at 5 pm. But, it doesn’t begin at 9 am either! And if you think you can be a good fit, we’d love for you to get to know us, so you can understand who to bother when you’re facing an issue, or whom to catch when you find a mistake.

How We Care For Spuulers
Grow With Us
We’re a small team with big dreams and we’re looking for people who aren’t afraid to dream with us. We’ll hire you because you know something we probably don’t, and we’d like you to help us fix it. We’re a rapidly growing business in an ever-evolving industry, and we’d like for you to be a part of this growth.

Your Time Is Important
Whether it’s an emergency, an occasion, or you just need a break from every day routine, our open leave policy and flexible work hours allow you to manage your personal time and business requirements such that a healthy balance is both achieved and maintained. There’s no ‘one size fits all’ recipe here, and you can decide when you’d like some time off, and you can decide how much time you need off.

Only Your Work Speaks For You
Just because you like wearing shorts, it doesn’t mean you aren’t serious about your work, contrary to popular perception. We don’t have a dress code and we probably never will. Our CEO walks into office with his collars turned up, and you’re free to come dressed in a three piece suit if you please! The only thing that will leave a lasting impression is every one of your contributions, no matter how big or small.

So when do we hear from you?

Regional Comp & Benefits Mgr | Singapore
 - (19002376)

Manage the development and delivery of Compensation and Benefits (C&B) policy and practice across assigned region to meet the needs of the business. Close liaison with the Total Rewards team and the broader regional team, Payroll, Talent Acquisition and Finance functions in the assigned region. Supports the company in the assigned region on global initiatives and administration, such as annual merit planning and cycle, bonus participation and administration, and benefits support.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

 Managing positive relationships with the business and ensuring the reputation and regard for HR is strong with all stakeholders.

 Ensuring all C&B policies and practices are legally compliant across the region and in line with business strategy and aims.

 Analyze C&B for the region through appropriate market evaluation on both a periodic and ad hoc basis. Partnering with HR colleagues and the business to develop and deliver business cases for change as required.

 Participate in C&B surveys as assigned.

 Conduct periodic analysis of appropriate tools (e.g. salary range data, job coding, salary banding) to ensure the recruitment and HR teams are always in possession of accurate and useable information to support the business.

 Managing annual and ad hoc salary review, mandated increases, signing bonuses and bonus payments with HR colleagues and the business.
 Managing relationships with local benefit vendors to ensure best value for the business.

 Supports merger and acquisition (M&A) work as required.
 Ensuring that enquires from employees and managers are handled promptly and effectively and escalated to HR colleagues when required or directed to other teams (e.g. Payroll and Talent Acquisition).

 Facilitate quality and accuracy of data on shared systems such as PeopleSoft.

 Collecting, reporting and acting on relevant Management Information as needed in the region.

 Contributing to HR projects across the region and internationally.

 Coordinate application of C&B policies and practices in line with regulation, best practice and the HR and business strategy.

 Responsible for ongoing training as C&B to improve managers’ understanding and use of C&B.


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS (please indicate if ‘preferred’)

 Significant, progressive experience in related C&B areas
 Prior experience working with benefit vendors
 Working knowledge of Microsoft products - - especially excel
 Strong communication and collaboration skills

Years of experience required: 5 years of progressive compensation & benefits experience

descriptions:
Req. ID: 128241
Job Description

As an Assembly Process Engineering Assistant at MSB, you will be primarily responsible for supporting daily line operational matters which includes material disposition, root cause investigation and yield tracking, setting up and updating operational procedure and specifications, as well as conducting training to Operations employees.Additional responsibilities include supporting qualification lots and customer samples, performing engineering evaluations and data collection as well as working on other projects as assigned.


Responsibilities and Tasks

Evaluate and Improve Assigned Assembly Manufacturing Processes, Materials, and/or Equipment


Identify, investigate, and document quality deviations


Troubleshoot deviations using systematic troubleshooting techniques


Ensure corrective action was taken to prevent reoccurrence of deviation


Troubleshoot process problems and determine the best course of action


Make process adjustments (adjust parameters to optimize quality and OPE)


Assist engineer with process developments


Verify correct process variables for production (i.e. materials, machine set points, etc.)


Monitor Process SPC and Cpk (Processs Capability)

Support in development/improvement of Process, Equipment and/or Material


Assist Engineer in conducting experiments (DOE)


Understand factors that impact process quality and propose solutions


Understand process limits and capabilities (CPK) and support process improvement evaluations

Assist in implementation of New Process and Process Changes to Operation


Assist Engineer in maintaining operation procedures/specification


Assist Engineer in Maintaining Assembly On-Line Document System (AODS) and change communication procedures: ECN (Engineering Change Notice)


Familiarize with Assembly qualification procedures


Maintain knowledge of material attributes (shelf life, storage requirements, etc.)


Coordinate and conduct training/briefing for operational personnel, i.e. PEM tech, Mfg POs, etc. on product/process requirement, machine and operation procedures


Communicate lesson learnt and training to operation personnel, i.e. PEM tech, Mfg POs, etc. on issues and corrective actions

Evaluate/Qualify New Device, Equipment and/or Material


Support new device FUT, qualification builds


Support new equipment evaluation and qualification builds


Support new material (direct or indirect) evaluation and qualification builds


Education

Required

Certificate

Diploma in Engineering

Desired

Other

Basic knowledge in semiconductor manufacturing techniques and technologies



Experience


Desired

Any number of years experience in any of the following:

Semiconductor related experience (5 years - for Senior position)


Qualifications


General understanding/knowledge of upstream and downstream processes and their impact to quality and reliability (added advantage)


Fast learner, with initiative and independence (min supervision)


Good team player


Familiar with QC tools, statistics application in manufacturing environment (added advantage)

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
For US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 or 208-368-4748 and/or submit: Job Information Request Form to: TJA@micron.com.

Telenor Group is one of the world’s major mobile operators. We keep our customers connected in 8 markets across Europe and Asia. More than 20,000 employees are committed to responsible business conduct and being our customers’ favourite partner in digital life. Connecting the world has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years, and we are driven by a singular vision: to empower societies. Telenor Group has 175 million mobile subscriptions and revenues of SGD 18 billion in 2017.
Telenor Procurement Company (TPC) , established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group. TPC delivers Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full accountability for the end-to-end sourcing process and performance of global spend categories.
About the role
As a Business Analyst you will be a part of the Performance & Analytics Team and report to Director of Performance & Analytics as part of the Finance Department. The main responsibility of the Performance & Analytics team is the saving methodology and calculation, and consolidating the performance reporting from the category teams. In this role, you'll work at the heart of TPC, providing the essential reporting, analytical, and financial support we need to stay at the cutting edge. That includes running key processes and tools, as well as delivering insightful analysis and reports to TPC management and Business Unit CxOs. We will look to you to identify potential challenges and areas for improvement.

What you will do
Perform various types of Business analysis and show initiative to deep dive into data
Explore opportunities to automate and improve current manual process to increase speed, precision and scalability
Ensure consistent financial, PO status and Savings reporting
Establish and build relationships with Category Procurement teams
Enable projects and category teams to report performance according to agreed framework
Advise on standards, procedures, methods, tools and techniques
Prepare material for Monthly Business Review through translating of complex information into simple and informative reporting

Profile
You are
A problem solver – capable of dissecting a complicated problem and evaluating it systematically and logically
Analytical – very comfortable working with large volumes of data
An strong communicator – who can condense complex information into an actionable result and can communicate this effectively to a range of audiences
Accountable – careful and thorough in accomplishing tasks
Driven – to make a big impact on the business and continuously improve processes
Demonstrating commitment, maturity, flexibility and speed in response to challenges
An individual with a high level of integrity and ethics, in line with the Telenor Way of working
You may have
Experience or at least a genuine interest in advanced data management and visualization tools such as Qliksense and Power BI.
3-5 years of work experience in procurement
Understanding of the Telecom Industry will be preferred
Competence Requirements
More than 5 years of work experience in a strategy or analyst role
University degree within Finance, Business Management or similar
Other information
Application Dateline : 18 October
We are not working with any recruitment agencies for this role

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.

foodpanda (small 'f') is the world's favourite way to order food online. With hundreds of restaurants ready to receive orders via our website and mobile app, no one should have to suffer from the lack of variety or long queues to enjoy great food.

We are seeking a highly motivated Head of New Business (APAC) to join our growing Regional team. You will be heading up an exciting new arm of the company. You are confident in your skills, has a great attitude, works hard and wants to join an overachieving team. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and is willing to go above and beyond. This is a unique opportunity to be an entrepreneur at foodpanda and grow a business arm from scratch.

What you will be doing?


Responsible for strategically planning and managing the growth of the groceries vertical across our APAC region.
Establish and implement short and long-term operational goals, objectives, strategic plans and initiatives
Monitor and evaluate programmatic and operational effectiveness, and implement changes required for improvement
Maintain metrics and analyse data to assess performance and implement improvements
Work effectively cross-functionally to improve workflow
Take full P&L ownership of the groceries vertical in the respective markets
Manage a regional and local team to plan and execute the launch and growth of the groceries vertical
Negotiate and build partnerships with key partners in the grocery industry
Be a mentor to the team and helping them to exceed their targets and support their career development

What we are looking for?


You have at least 5 years working experience in e-commerce or groceries industry, in a strategic business development function
Strong understanding of the traditional groceries business operations and e-commerce
Having a commercial and operational mindset
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong analytical abilities
Ability to work well under pressure, detail-oriented and employs a proactive approach to problem-solving
An entrepreneurial mindset with the willingness to challenge the status quo
Willingness to travel (up to 50%)
Process-oriented as well as strong organizational skills with a hands-on mentality
Team player with an ability to function effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

At Dyson we demand the highest standard of performance from the technologies we engineer. Our people expect the same from the technology that supports them. We are a community that appreciates and advocates better engineering. A community of pioneers.
We are currently seeking a Data Analyst intern to join the Business Intelligence Team in our world class Research Design and Development department. Our Business Intelligence Team is responsible for global reporting and the analysis of projects during the product development stage. The team plays a vital role in supporting the engineering teams worldwide.
Join us as an intern and from day one you’ll be assigned to a live project with the chance to have a meaningful impact on the evolution of Dyson technology.

Accountabilities
You will be working with the Business Intelligence team to ensure that the reporting needs of the business stakeholders are met. The team is responsible for capturing requirements, designing, building and deploying reports according to stakeholders’ needs. They are responsible for the end to end delivery of insightful data and analysis.
You will be assigned to a live project team putting your skill set into practice from the get go. Some of your tasks may include:
Supporting and maintaining existing reports and dashboards
Capturing clear requirements direct from business stakeholders
Iterating report solutions using a design, build and test methodology
Using best practice design and visualisation techniques to allow users to see and understand their data
Creating analytical solutions that impress, inspire and become essential tools
Review and deliver insightful recommendations based on analytical solutions
Apart from the technical know-how, you will need to be an inquisitive self-starter who is passionate about learning and creative in problem solving. With a combination of hands on experience and dedicated training, we will offer you the chance to develop your skills and experience.
Skills
Our internships are competitive and delivering the next generation of Dyson technology is tough, so you’ll need to be:
Studying towards a 2:1 or above in a computer science / engineering / mathematics / data science related degree
Able to demonstrate ability to solve problems with an analytical and logical approach
Able to understand and manipulate large and complex data sets
Enthusiastic about data analysis and data visualization (e.g. tableau or statistical experience) - this can be demonstrated through your project or past experience
A quick learner and an effective communicator – to be able to thrive in Dyson’s fast-paced environment
We like people who show some get-up-and-go and passion for what they do. We’ll expect a lot from you. And no day will be the same as the last.
Benefits
Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.

Your core responsibility is to work with the data team to process and analyze structured data to extract insights on customers’ purchase preferences.
Data analytics is our core capability and the data team will report directly to the CEO.
Main responsibilities:
Generate insights using customer’s purchase data, from data preparation to application.
Build and support classification model.
Build and support recommender system.
Analyze app usage and drive user engagement.
Ensure data integrity and quality.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
At least 5 years experience in manipulating large datasets and working with databases. Candidates with lesser experience can be considered for a junior role.
Strong analytical skills with solid statistical concepts, and be able to apply in a business environment.

job_titles: Digital Transformation of Physical Industries – Research Analyst (Singapore)
descriptions:
Digital Transformation of Physical Industries – Research Analyst
Digital innovations and the Internet of Things (IoT) are transforming traditional, nondigital industries like energy, automotive, food, and healthcare and their supply chains. However, how it will affect these industries and what a winning digital strategy looks like for those within these industries is less clear. These organizations need to successfully obtain and integrate new data sources, devices, and capabilities all while under pressure to be more efficient. Lux Research is seeking candidates to research the Digital Transformation of Physical Industries to help clients use or develop these technologies to grow their businesses. Clients include multi-national energy, electronics, materials, and consumer goods companies in addition to investor, academic, and government groups.
Analysts spend their time speaking with innovative technology developers and clients, attending and speaking at conferences, and analyzing their findings to help clients make informed decisions. A Digital Transformation of Physical Industries analyst will be exposed to a wide range of technologies including Industrial IoT, wireless communication technologies, sensors, and analytics solutions to develop research like technology roadmaps, market sizes, and supply chain dynamics.
The Analyst in this role will:
Be recognized as a leading expert on the progress and impact of digital innovations including sensors, industrial IoT deployments, embedded systems, application enablement, IoT devices, connectivity, and others.
Bring and further build an exceptional network of contacts active in emerging IoT technologies.
Be skilled at visualizing the impact and assessing the market potential of innovative new technologies and business models.
Be well-versed in crafting corporate strategy for managing emerging technologies and their implications.
Grasp the impact of policy, subsidies, and other regulatory factors on technology adoption and impact.
Develop new concepts, big ideas, and analytical frameworks to help clients and colleagues understand the shifting IoT landscape and the business opportunities it creates.
Responsibilities:
Work with a geographically diverse team to develop and test research hypotheses and prepare findings for clients.
Conduct primary interviews with senior-level executives at large corporations, technology start-ups, and other organizations.
Conduct secondary research drawing on diverse sources, including business and trade press, academic publications, patent filings, and conference presentations.
Produce written research reports, including creative visual depictions of data and ideas.
Understand client business needs to develop and deliver high-value research.
Help develop and launch new client service offerings.
Develop a network of contacts and relationships among business and scientific leaders in emerging technologies.
Coach, mentor, and manage research team members, assisting with team members' professional development.
Requirements:
Minimum two years work or postgraduate experience with a background or experience in one or more of the following: computer science, materials science, chemistry, physics, chemical engineering, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, or biomedical engineering.
Deep intellectual curiosity about emerging technologies, especially in IoT; including data acquisition, analytics, platforms, hardware, and components.
Willingness to do whatever it takes to meet client needs in a fast-moving, rapidly growing, start-up environment.
Entrepreneurial, enthusiastic, collegial, and collaborative approach to work.
High degree of organization and attention to detail; ability to juggle multiple tasks.
Ability to write clearly and incisively about business and technical topics.
Superior listening and critical thinking skills, and ability to speak articulately and think on your feet; a good sense of humor is a major plus.
Strong analytical skill, both qualitative and quantitative.
A strong record of academic achievement. Bachelor's degree required; Master's degree or Ph.D. is a plus.
Fluency in spoken and written Mandarin, Japanese, or Korean is a plus; Western European or Middle Eastern language skills are also desirable.

Job no: 493954
Work type: Contract, full-time
Singapore university of technology and design is searching for excellent researchers in Aviation and transport related design, master planning, and/or infrastructure.

Project Description
This research is a main thrust in a university wide interdepartmental excellence cluster looking at the aviation sector. The specific research this is titled ‘Aviation: Horizon 2050” and focuses on the future of aviation terminal design towards the middle of this decade, specifically in the growing South East Asia region. It aims to research the 5 key scales of airport design: global, city, terminal, building, and user-experience in a progressive and connected way. Initially finding insight relating to future aviation terminals; looking at world economic and demographic trends, leading to aviation demand predictions, in parallel exploring technological disruptors to existing airport and airport-city-interfaces such as infrastructure and transportation innovation; translating this into effects on the terminal to allow the presentation of new proposals for novel adaptive airport and terminal building forms relevant to the South East Asian environment.
This work will be disseminated in various ways over the total 5-year duration, as publications and also though collaborations with industry especially designers and operations/commissioning bodies.

Researcher Description
The successful applicant would ideally have a strong academic background in architectural design or building engineering, ideally with a substantive aviation research or industry experience (either a university degree and/or over 2 years’ sector relevant work experience). People with a more analytical/systems/economic background may also be considered as the project will be supported by a number of collaborating researchers. They should be passionate about the aviation sector and keen to produce high quality design that is underpinned by carful research and technical scientific thinking.
The job aims to give a motivated self-starter the research freedom and space to explore new concepts, supported and guided within a group of domain experts with broad but strong academic and industrial backgrounds. The SUTD environment is new and well suited to those with initiative both professionally and socially.

Education

Undergraduate or Master’s degree in Architecture, Urban Planning, or Design Based Engineering (Civil, Structural, Aviation, Systems-Engineering)
Skills

Keen design sense
Ability to work in 3D and over large differences in scale
Creative approach to problem solving in design
Ability to be self-lead and agile towards a results driven working style
Desired Proficiency (not all are required)

Adobe Creative Suite (esp. Photoshop and InDesign)
3D modelling (Rhino3D, AutoCAD, etc.)
Parametric modelling (Grasshopper, Dynamo BIM)
Python (Jupyter Notebook, data analytics)
Web Development (Java Script, Node.js)
Benefits

Health Insurance
Time for publication
Funding for international conferences
Requirements

Letter of interest
C.V.
Recent publication (if any) or work portfolio (if relevant)
Links to current online work / GitHub (if relevant)


Any research or position questions please direct to sam_joyce@sutd.edu.sg

This Project will be working under the Meta Design Lab http://metadesignlab.com/

About the job
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes, from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver 100+ operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across 70+ countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.

The Extended Workforce Solutions(xWS) team, is part of Google People Services Operations function, which is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers.

This role is a single contributor role in APAC. The xWS team, is a global, specialist support team, providing the infrastructure to support Alphabet’s Temps, Vendors and Independent Contractor (T-V-C) population. It is responsible for xWS risk in APAC, covering multiple jurisdictions in the region.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. Responsibilities

Act as the risk lead for the Extended Workforce Solutions team in APAC.

Consult as a subject matter expert around contingent labor policy to a diverse range of client groups and partner teams. Educate partners to accelerate scale and impact across Google.

Use a customer focused mindset and educate customers on best practices when engaging contingent labor.

Be an effective advocate for change; identify instances of incorrect classification of worker types and support business model change as required. Drive creation and maintenance of T-V-C policies intended to mitigate multiple areas of T-V-C risk while supporting the Google business strategy.

Monitor external legislation proactively, create and adjust T-V-C policy as needed. Develop and maintain relationships with internal and external contingent workforce ecosystem (Legal, Operational, Security & Investigations teams) in order to identify impacts to extended workforce policy.

Do you wake up in the middle of the night thinking you’ve solved the P versus NP problem, only to realize that it was a dream and you are back in the sub-optimal real world? Do you wish you could do something to make this latter more efficient? Do you eat Ant Colonies, Tabus and Markov Chains for breakfast while reading the Operations Research journal?

Then we may have the gig you’re looking for!

Zyllem is a fast growing regional start-up based in Singapore. Our software connects the fragmented logistics network by allowing enterprises to build and manage their entire distribution network that includes partnerships and own assets in one platform. As a start-up company shaking things up in the technology industry, we are always looking into ways to innovate. This is an awesome opportunity for someone who can think on their feet, participate in brainstorming sessions, share knowledge and ideas..... all while having fun with a team of like-minded people from all around the world.

Our customers use our platform to streamline and optimize their logistic processes. Optimization problems in the field are plenty, data is abundant, and therefore fun is limitless.

You’re great at:

Understanding, brainstorming on and communicating about optimization problems in the fields of logistics and supply chain (and you have a track record to acknowledge that!)
Building models to solve hard combinatorial problems using proven algorithms, heuristics or any mathematical tool you see fit
Developing and implementing algorithms in C# or Python
Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
Creating visualizations to present the results produced by your algorithms
Qualifications and Skills

A bachelor/master degree in a field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or something closely related to those fields (strong maths and analysis skills are needed)
Proven working experience of at least 5 years in a similar role and position
Great communication skills
 “Nice to haves” a.k.a. what makes you even more wonderful:

You are familiar with modern Software development tools and practices
You have experience in all stages of algorithms life-cycle (design, implementation and operation)
You have already worked in a startup, so you understand how things can be
Here’s a bit about us…

Zyllemites are good, smart people with a great sense of humour. We enjoy hanging out with each other on Friday over drinks. We speak many languages and respect all cultures. We take our work seriously, but ourselves not too much. Professionalism and integrity are work ethics we strive for.

So if corporate life leaves you cold, and you can stand the creative chaos of a tech start up in the “world’s most tightly packed entrepreneurial ecosystem” (yup, according to The Economist, Blk 71 is the centre of the start up universe…) then let’s talk!

P.S. Even if this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who’d be a perfect fit. Send them this link. Thanks!

Regional Comp & Benefits Mgr | Singapore
 - (19002376)

Manage the development and delivery of Compensation and Benefits (C&B) policy and practice across assigned region to meet the needs of the business. Close liaison with the Total Rewards team and the broader regional team, Payroll, Talent Acquisition and Finance functions in the assigned region. Supports the company in the assigned region on global initiatives and administration, such as annual merit planning and cycle, bonus participation and administration, and benefits support.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

 Managing positive relationships with the business and ensuring the reputation and regard for HR is strong with all stakeholders.

 Ensuring all C&B policies and practices are legally compliant across the region and in line with business strategy and aims.

 Analyze C&B for the region through appropriate market evaluation on both a periodic and ad hoc basis. Partnering with HR colleagues and the business to develop and deliver business cases for change as required.

 Participate in C&B surveys as assigned.

 Conduct periodic analysis of appropriate tools (e.g. salary range data, job coding, salary banding) to ensure the recruitment and HR teams are always in possession of accurate and useable information to support the business.

 Managing annual and ad hoc salary review, mandated increases, signing bonuses and bonus payments with HR colleagues and the business.
 Managing relationships with local benefit vendors to ensure best value for the business.

 Supports merger and acquisition (M&A) work as required.
 Ensuring that enquires from employees and managers are handled promptly and effectively and escalated to HR colleagues when required or directed to other teams (e.g. Payroll and Talent Acquisition).

 Facilitate quality and accuracy of data on shared systems such as PeopleSoft.

 Collecting, reporting and acting on relevant Management Information as needed in the region.

 Contributing to HR projects across the region and internationally.

 Coordinate application of C&B policies and practices in line with regulation, best practice and the HR and business strategy.

 Responsible for ongoing training as C&B to improve managers’ understanding and use of C&B.


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS (please indicate if ‘preferred’)

 Significant, progressive experience in related C&B areas
 Prior experience working with benefit vendors
 Working knowledge of Microsoft products - - especially excel
 Strong communication and collaboration skills

Years of experience required: 5 years of progressive compensation & benefits experience

Part of the CMA CGM Group, APL is one of the world’s leading ocean carriers, providing world-class container shipping and terminal services, as well as intermodal operations supported by leading-edge IT and ecommerce.
APL offers transcontinental cargo shipping across Asia, North and South America, Europe, the Middle East, the Indian subcontinent and Australia through more than 90 weekly services, calling ports in over 50 countries worldwide.
.
BRIEF DESCRIPTION
The Strategic Liner Management team (SLM) acts as the analytical centre to facilitate optimum asset allocation and yield management decisions by APL’s various trade teams, The team is leading the adoption of cutting edge techniques & technologies in business analytics and machine learning to drive business improvement opportunities within the Trade and Yield group. As a specialist within the Advanced Analytics team the incumbent will apply their analytical skills to structured and unstructured data gathered from APL’s databases and external sources, to generate commercially valuable insights. He/she will be expected to support the Head- Advanced Yield Analytics in projects that will apply data science techniques to drive decision making for the trade teams. He/she will also be expected to quickly learn to use any 3rd party analytics tool that the team may deploy.
KEY RESULT AREAS
Provide actionable recommendations to trade teams using advanced data science techniques
Execute at least 3 Advanced Analytics projects per year with positive feedback by trade
Improve vessel utilization through proactive utilization forecasting and capacity management. >90% avg. accuracy of predictions for vessel utilization forecasting
Reduce booking fall down %
Increase trade yield/ contribution
Reduce pricing turn time
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
The specialist will work under the guidance of Head- Advanced Yield Analytics and assist to:
Coordinate information collection efforts across the different trade teams and other departments as required
Execute data analysis using suitable tools (Excel, R, Python, SQL etc.)
Build dashboards that help visualize the data and highlight insights
Package recommendations in easy to understand format for stakeholders such as trade managers, senior management
Execute any other ad-hoc tasks to support Strategic Liner Management projects
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education : Bachelors or Masters’ degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics or Computer Science
Experience :
Expertise within data analytics scope
Strong knowledge of various data mining and data modelling tools and their capabilities
Ability to develop and deploy Machine Learning models
Excel VBA macro writing skills a plus
Prior experience in container shipping or logistics industry a plus
Skills Set
Experience using data science toolsets such as Python, R, SQL
Competent with Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written with ability to pitch ideas and influence the stakeholders
Strong analytical, conceptualization and problem-solving skills
Competencies
Able to work with structured and unstructured data
Analysis and Problem solving
Attention to details
Tolerance of ambiguity
Team player
Results oriented
Good communication and interpersonal skills
**Salary package (local) & job title shall commensurate with experience.
**Please send a copy of your resume to Carita.liu@apl.com & Cynthia.soh@apl.com (in word format) together with a para (or pointers) why you are suitable for the role, with the reason/s for you to consider a move from your current/latest organisation, your current/latest salary details (i.e. monthly base salary, any AWS, variable bonus and/or other fixed cash allowances), expected salary & your notice period/earliest joining date.
**Kindly note that only short-listed applicants will be contacted.

JOB POSITION: ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE - APAC Enterprise Sales
Location: Singapore
THE OPPORTUNITY:
Due to our rapid expansion across APAC, Protegrity is seeking a highly seasoned Account Executive to support our business. We are seeking Account Executives with at least 3 years' experience in selling subscription-based licensing, into complex enterprise accounts (revenue in excess $1bn+). Individuals must have experience of selling Data Management/Governance, Analytics or Cyber Security solutions into Financial Services, Healthcare, and/or Public-Sector Accounts within Singapore.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS FOR ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE:
At least 5 years' experience in Enterprise Software sales, with a proven track record of:
Closing subscription-based software deals worth more than $3m+.
Successfully selling enterprise software solutions into organisations with revenues of $1bn+.
Managing a portfolio of accounts and generating multiple opportunities within each account.
Self-starter with demonstrable presentation, problem solving/analytical skills and consultative manner.
Proven track record of managing the end-to-end new business sales process – from qualification to closure.
Ability to identify and articulate the value of investing in Protegrity's solution to customers and partners.
Previous experience selling to Financial Services, Healthcare and/or the Public-Sector within Singapore.
Established relationships with relevant senior decision makers across target prospects and partners.
Well-developed interpersonal skills with an ability to influence and manage multi-party opportunities.
Ability to leverage channel partners effectively to maximize opportunities across the portfolio of accounts.
Demonstrated commitment to partner and customer success/satisfaction.
Solid understanding of subscription-based licensing sales.
Expert user of Salesforce and Microsoft Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Fluency in English essential, Mandarin preferred.
Singaporean Citizens or Permanent Residents preferred.
ADDITIONAL PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE:
Previous experience selling Big Data, Cloud, Analytics or database/data warehouse solutions.
Experience within the Data Security, Data Governance/Management, Analytics or Cyber Security markets.
Experience co-selling with Global Systems Integrators, Distributors, Hadoop and IaaS/SaaS vendors.
Track record of engaging and presenting at various levels – from CxO to Architects and Domain leads.
Ability to build close trusted advisor relationships with key decision makers.
Natural ability to create urgency and build momentum within accounts.
Ability to identify multiple initiatives within each account and identify shared stakeholders.
Experience of managing customer renewals/success.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES FOR ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE:
Understand and present Protegrity's Value Proposition to customers, prospects, partners and internal contacts.
Identify new business sales opportunities and manage the sales process (including RFI's/RFP's, where appropriate).
Manage new and existing account relationships.
Create and deliver compelling presentations, both in-person and virtually.
Documenting and updating Salesforce as required.
Travel as required (up to 50%).
Foster and develop relationships with partners.
Ensure customers continually renew subscriptions.
Other duties as may be appropriate and applicable.
EDUCATION:
Bachelor's Degree from accredited academic institution required
Higher Education and/or demonstrable commitment to continued learning preferred.

PLEASE ATTACH A DETAILED RESUME
THE COMPANY:
Over 300 public and private sector organisations have chosen Protegrity to protect their data globally.
Recognized by Gartner as 1 of only 2 vendors offering full Data Centric Audit and Protection (DCAP) capabilities across all data silos.
Implemented in 5 of the 25 largest banks in the world (S&P Global Market Intelligence report 2018).
Full Data Security Lifecycle capabilities, from Discovery and Protection to Monitoring and Enforcement.
Consistent protection across all enterprise environments from Mainframe, Data Warehouses, RDBMS to Hadoop, IaaS, SaaS and the full data governance, BI and Decision Support layers.
Native support across hybrid Hadoop-IaaS architectures, (including multi-cloud) with native protectors across Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR, AWS, Google Cloud, Salesforce, etc.
Support for all proven Protection Methods, including Encryption (AES256, 3DES, CUSP, etc.) Format-Preserving Encryption (NIST compliant), Vault-less Tokenization (proprietary) and Masking (Dynamic and Static data masking)
Support for all Data Types and most common Encoding Formats.
Ability to deploy on-premise in AWS, Google Cloud or any combination as needed, without impacting licensing costs.
Commercial model that offers predictable costs for end-to-end Data Security, regardless of how dataflows change.
Protegrity is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About the Company

Circles.Life is Asia's first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in 2016 and have been rapidly gaining market share while delivering best in class customer experience. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth.

We have an opening for an BRM/OCS/PCRF Expert who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in a hyper-growth environment in Singapore.

Do you want to get first-hand insights on how a hyper-growth company operates?

Are you interested in being part of a fun, energetic team that thrives in an entrepreneurial tech environment?

If the answer is YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life!

Job Description

As our BRM/OCS/PCRF Expert, you will be responsible for the operations and maintenance, performance analysis, design & product implementation and QA based on business needs You will also be reverse engineering and troubleshooting complex application architecture from documentation and requirements baseline when available. Your responsibilities are as per below: -


Create, document and implement OCS/PCRF features.
Troubleshoot interworking issues with PS/CS core systems and analyse traces
Handle daily operations support tasks in a 24*7 environment.
Participate in solution design and development for expansion and rollout.
Perform analyse and review applications being released into production.
Create, test and deploy rate plans and products on OCS platform
Install, patch and maintain OCS and PCRF Applications
Define and execute Backup/Restoration procedures for disaster management
Forecast and plan capacity for systems and storage on OCS/PCRF applications
Support QA and Customer Support Teams for operations, testing, and customer

escalations

Analyse and improve performance of OCS with oracle database
Provisioning of customers on HLR through API gateway.

Job Requirements


7+ years Operations Experience in a large-scale Network Operator in a multivendor environment
Experience in all aspects of project implementation lifecycle charging/policy
Minimum of Five (5) years' hands on experience supporting OCS/PCRF applications with Tier-1 Telco/Vendor Experience
Hands on experience on OCS/PCRF/SCP systems (Oracle ECE experience will be preferred)
Experience with Diameter GX, GY, RO, SP, RX interfaces, signalling flows and AAA protocol.
SQL/plSQL statements (create, select, insert, delete)
Basic knowledge of shell/Perl scripting.
Knowledge of GSM, INAP, CAP, SS7, SIGTRAN and IP networking protocols.
Understanding of signalling flows for voice, data, SMS.
Wireshark tracing and packet capture
Hands on experience of core networks (GGSN/SGSN) is desirable.
Knowledge and experience Change Management, Fault management, Incident Management
ITIL foundation certification will be a plus.
Ability to interface equally well with various levels of technical personnel, Application users, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), and senior level stakeholders as required.

General information
Entity
Crédit Agricole CIB is the corporate and investment banking arm of Credit Agricole Group, the 13th largest banking group worldwide in terms of tier 1 capital (The Banker, July 2018). Nearly 8,000 employees in 34 countries across Europe, the Americas, Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and North Africa support the Bank's clients, meeting their financial needs throughout the world. Crédit Agricole CIB offers its large corporate and institutional clients a range of products and services in capital markets activities, investment banking, structured finance, commercial banking and international trade. The Bank is a pioneer in the area of climate finance, and is currently a market leader in this segment with a complete offer for all its clients.


For more information, please visit www.ca-cib.com

job_titles: Head of Community Operations, Uber Eats APAC
descriptions:
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

We are looking for the APAC head of the CommOps business for UberEats. You will be a critical member of the APAC Community Operations Leadership team, responsible for ensuring that Uber's frontliners are empowered with the information they need to provide world class support for customers, restaurants and delivery partners while aligning with business growth, and profitability and reputation goals.

To do this, you'll oversee a team that manages support delivery footprint, ensure agents are set up for success with resources and training, closely manage high visibility support programs, and partner closely with business owners to improve the customer experience. As this is a senior management role, you will need to build and manage a high performing team as well as work closely with other senior stakeholders in the organization.

The right person is ready to make tough, data driven decisions in a high-stakes, high-speed environment. They are passionate about Uber, customer obsessed, and ready to tackle big problems head on.
What You’ll Do

Develop a customer support strategy that is consistent with Uber's overall vision but tailored to the unique needs of each market in APAC
Grow and lead a large team – build and lead a high performing team that is geographically dispersed
Own programs and outcomes - take charge of tough challenges and ensure we're continuing to raise the bar with the quality of our support, sales and processing activities
Be bold and entrepreneurial - the speed of our growth means the support playbook you may have learned may need to have a few pages rewritten
Act like a marketer - excellent support drives growth; make sure we provide share-worthy experiences to customers that inspire them to tell their friends about Uber
Know the numbers - drive the metrics we use to evaluate Community Operations, including speed, efficiency, quality, and thoroughness. As well as employee morale and business partner satisfaction.
Represent the customer's voice - be a critical thought partner

What You’ll Need
Experience: Significant experience running business units and scaling support organizations; some high-growth operations strongly preferred
Program management: Experience managing multiple projects and programs with various specialisations and stakeholders.
People Management: Experience managing remote teams across multiple cultures.
Senior Relationships: Ability to be effective working with senior leaders across multiple functions and regions.

About the Team

At Uber, support is more than just answering questions. It's about using the information customers give us as insights to help Uber grow. Moreover, providing amazing support that establishes trust within our community-riders, driver partners, UberEats customers and delivery partners-is at the centre of the Uber customer experience. We're obsessed about providing the highest quality service, in the smartest way. And for Uber to continue its growth and success, we need to be able to not only improve but also scale our fast-growing support operations.

Job Details
We are currently seeking a Talent Advisor to grow our highly talented Ohana at Salesforce. This senior person will be responsible for sophisticated client and candidate management supporting the entire recruiting process. Serve as a trusted advisor to the business, guiding and advising on market trends and opportunities through data intelligence and expertise.

Responsibilities:
Source, recruit and hire professionals across a wide range of roles while managing process from sourcing to offer acceptance
Create comprehensive sourcing and recruitment strategies while leveraging internal resources in order to hire the best talent in the market
Develop strong relationships with hiring managers, candidates and cross-functional partners in order to create a best in class hiring experience, from recruiting through onboarding
Own a seat at the table with business leaders to understand and drive recruitment strategy
Build a strong brand in the market, proactively networking, cold calling, and “deep dive” into passive candidate networks through various markets and channels
Serve as a mentor and onboarding guide to new members of the recruiting organization including, but not limited to, recruiters, recruiting coordinators and sourcers
Apply sound judgement, attempt to handle escalations independently but know when to escalate to leadership
Proactively anticipate challenges and mitigate risk
Create a strategy around advancing the business forward and drive that strategy to completion
Anticipate needs of clients and deliver solutions before requested
Required Skills/Experience:
Proven track record sourcing and hiring passive candidates from direct competitors
8+ years of technical recruiting experience (experienced PhD Recruiting is a bonus)
Network, cold-call, “deep dive” into networks throughout various markets and build relationships via phone and in-person throughout the Singapore market
Proven track record delivering of high level client and candidate experience, superior negotiation and closing skills, and comfort navigating ambiguity
Ability to handle complex and sophisticated searches
Strong business acumen with demonstrated experience partnering and influencing senior hiring managers and executives throughout the recruiting cycle
Ability to articulate the Salesforce story and value proposition to candidates
Strategic thinker who brings resolution to any challenges and problems throughout the recruiting process
Analytical and metrics oriented: Demonstrated ability to drive business and behavioral changes with data
Ability to pivot and quickly adapt to changing business needs and priorities
Strong communication and presentation skills
Proficient in forecasting to determine headcount targets and quarterly ending numbers
Working knowledge of ATS tools and technologies
Desired Skills/Experience:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
Familiarity with technology markets and experience recruiting for a growing technology company strongly preferred
Prior background recruiting senior/executive level candidates, a plus

job_titles: Senior Officer, Country & Credit Risk Management, Group Risk Management
descriptions:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Credit and Risk Management function is comprised of three teams: Risk Management, Credit and Special Asset Management. We manage the risks arising from the Group’s business activities within the risk appetite established by the Board. This involves identifying and evaluating the risks, developing effective risk governance and strategies as well as providing independent assessment of the overall risk profile.
Job Responsibilities

Generate quarterly financial reports (credit risk related)
Perform benchmarking of Group’s financial disclosure credit risk sections against peers and regulatory requirements
Implement and maintain reporting procedures to comply with internal control requirements
Identify process improvement and report automation opportunities for better efficiency
Support User Acceptance Testing for data source changes
Assist in ad-hoc credit risk related assignments and participate in other projects as required
Job Requirements

Meticulous, analytical and logical
Possess the drive and energy to work around resource constraints to achieve required objectives
Able to work independently under tight timelines
Strong Microsoft Excel/VBA and SQL programming skills
Good command of English and writing skills
Be a part of UOB Family

Apply now and make a difference.

descriptions:
