At Amazon we believe that Customer trust is of paramount importance to anything we do. To continue building customer trust the Selling Partner Abuse team works with brands, merchants and customers to identify and prevent product abuse in areas such as copyright, trademark and counterfeit for our customers worldwide.

We are looking for an analytical candidate to join the APAC Selling Partner Abuse team in Singapore as a Business Analyst. In this role you will generate actionable insights through the development of metrics, dashboards and deep dive analyses. You will work closely with our machine learning and data science group in defining and implementing new initiatives. You will serve as the business metrics guru and insight provider in our team to assess, to prevent, and to predict e-commerce risk. You will do this in partnership with other Amazon compliance teams including Product Quality & Safety, Selling Partner Performance, and Brand Registry across our APAC websites for Amazon.

The Selling Partner Abuse APAC team covers abuse for Retail and 3P in JP, IN, AU, CN, and SG. When brand partners notify us of suspected infringement of intellectual property or when we detect suspected fraud, we investigate and take the appropriate action. To continue building customer trust, we invest in processes, policies and tools to prevent product abuse and fraud. We are adding a business analyst to help us generate customer insights, track existing and emerging abuse vectors, and quantify our progress across the APAC region. In this role you will closely partner with other teams including Product Quality, Safety, Compliance, Fraud and Legal. We measure our success in how quickly and accurately we identify and eliminate cases of product abuse and fraud to protect customers and to protect intellectual property rights on Amazon across APAC.

Experience working in risk management, brand protection, fraud or compliance organizationsFamiliarity with data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, AWS QuicksightExperience working with machine learning models and data science teamsAbility to write quality, maintainable, and robust code, including in SQL or JavaMaster Degree

job_titles: Manager, Learning Content Programs and Partnerships
descriptions:
Minimum qualifications:
Master’s degree in Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

Business development experience making media or internet agreements.

Experience leading financial agreements and managing strategic partnerships in TV/media or internet with content creators.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience working with data management and YouTube’s Content Management System.

Experience negotiating complex partner and content acquisition/funding agreements.

Knowledge of the learning content industry.

Fluency with, or willingness to learn, technological concepts, financial models, product features and education/learning policies.

Ability to think strategically, convert complex issues into straightforward, timely action, and work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Demonstrated ability to influence and communicate cross-functionally and externally.
About the job
As a Manager on the Content Partnerships team at YouTube, you'll have a unique opportunity to create long-lasting relationships with your portfolio of partners, and to apply and hone business skills in an entrepreneurial environment. You're comfortable working on complex content agreements with partners, as well as working cross-functionally with colleagues across multiple disciplines, to ensure our partners are positioned for success on YouTube and to provide the best possible experience for our users.

As Manager, Learning Content Programs and Partnerships in APAC, you'll drive the ongoing regional growth trajectory and the development of a thriving, sustainable educational creator ecosystem and YouTube Learning business.

You'll help establish the regional learning strategy and related plans within APAC, while working with local strategic partner managers to develop and drive initiatives to enhance the position of our Learning on YouTube business, and support creator success.

You'll leverage your negotiation and collaboration skills to build our learning narrative through internal and external partnerships, while crafting communications and leading engagements that ensure our creators take full advantage of YouTube and Google's ever-growing suite of offerings, optimize their channel on YouTube and identify growth opportunities.

You'll use your analytical skills and strategic mindset to define and negotiate content agreements, lead a portfolio of Learning accounts across key markets, and directly manage the growth of their channels and businesses on YouTube, while having oversight of related OPEX and CAC budgets.

You'll simultaneously ensure that teammates are informed of learning trends, insights and opportunities in the region, to ensure that our products and practices continue to lead and support the market.
YouTube has grown into a community used by over 1 billion people across the globe to access information, share video, and shape culture. The YouTube team helps budding creators build careers, creates products like YouTube Kids, YouTube Music, and YouTube Gaming, and engages communities around shared passions and global conversations. Together, we empower the world to create, broadcast, and share. Responsibilities

Lead strategic regional plans/programs while supporting local initiatives. Collaborate with Family and Learning Scaled Partner Management to foster/support vertical and partner growth, including multi-session learning content initiatives aligned with product and platform plans.

Identify educational content demand areas, and prioritize on-boarding of partners. Work with external stakeholders to expand high-quality learning programming on the platform and enhance our credibility within the EDU space.

Initiate and manage day-to-day operations and partner/creator relationships with a portfolio of accounts, prioritize incoming requests, troubleshoot partner systems around reporting, content management and create business plans and reports on partner and vertical performance.

Liaise with YouTube and Google cross-functional teams while collaborating with creators on projects.

Negotiate and execute content partnerships and content agreements, while defining, analyzing and communicating milestones and metrics to enable vertical and partner success.

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.
We Offer

You will be part of the APAC Division and Group Chief Data Officer (CDO) in the front-to-back adoption and implementation of the Enterprise Data Governance Policy and Data Management Framework.
You will ensure adoption and compliance to BCBS239 principles.
You will deliver and actively maintain data lineage and front to back documentation for the division.
You will collaborate with other divisional or global functions (front office, operations, compliance, risk management, finance, IT, Group CDO) in defining relevant standards, policies, procedures and operating models.
You will drive management and resolution of relevant data quality issues.
You will find opportunities for more effective management and use of data.
You Offer

You possess experience in the business capabilities and underlying data needs.
You have experience in technological infrastructure and business processes architecture.
You have tested project management skills and ability to work independently against tight timeline.
Self starter, you have the ability to understand technical details and to articulate those in the overall operational and strategic context.
You have professional presentation skills, ability to effectively engage partners and senior management.
You are a strong team-player, effectively work and communicate with relevant partners/colleagues in a collaborative, transparent manner and able to master new material quickly.
You have good communication, organizational and interpersonal skills.
You have a BA or above with relevant experience in management consulting, projects and/or data science.

At Amazon.com, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people.

Would you like to be a central part of a recruiting team that is responsible for fueling the rapid business growth for Amazon Prime Now? If you are a builder, who thrives in high growth, ambiguous environments, we want you on our team!

This role will be responsible for working closely with various business stakeholders to define the sourcing strategy, generate high caliber talents and close top candidates; all within a fast-moving and super dynamic environment. You will handle the Recruitment activities for all roles across the Retail and Operations functions of Amazon Prime Now!

You will have the opportunity to draw on your extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition to relate to the functional areas of the business; and forge dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners.

Core Responsibilities:

Work closely with business in order to deeply understand teams’ organization structure, responsibilities, strengths/weaknesses and key business drivers. Utilize this information to develop most effective recruiting strategies.Build and maintain network of potential candidates through proactive market research and on-going relationship management, gauging chemistry of candidates for fit and motivation rather than simply sell a role. Meanwhile, manage to ensure all sourcing channels are sufficiently utilized, including but not limited to employee referrals, career portals, search firms, campus/MBA events, job fairs, etc.Consult on ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer. Also, articulated in writing recruiting plans with deliverables, timelines and a formal tracking process.Active participation in the full cycle recruiting efforts, including emphasis on the capability of assessment skills to help evaluating candidates and ensuring the highest bar.Lead final assessment and selection process.In charge of the offer proposal and negotiation process.Manage well on all the data associated with the recruitment process.Emphasis on continuous improvement, as such it is expected that you will spend time to ensure ongoing education of hiring managers and interviews on recruitment “best practice” and interview skills training.Implement the recruitment tools/systems in region through active collaboration with global contacts.

Strong commitment to continuous improvement.Ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships.Ability to continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to sourcing and delivering candidates.Ability to execute recruiting strategy, including employer promotion in the marketplace, candidate management, diversity sourcing, and interview process management.Self-sufficient and able to work with little direct supervision.Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, as a team leader and member.Possession of strong analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team.Experience recruiting in a highly competitive environment.

Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good work ethic and judgment

job_titles: Supply Co-ordinator/ Supply Chain Graduate Trainee
descriptions:
Main responsibilities:

This position is responsible for the supply chain operations and management of the flow of products, spares and equipment in and out of the site.The incumbent must ensure that orders from our Customer Service teams are handled correctly and in a timely fashion, ensuring supply continuity and supporting “On-Time, In-Full” (OTIF) delivery performance to our site network and our customers in that country location.There is a strong drive towards supply chain excellence through continuous improvement initiatives and developing best practices.This is an exciting opportunity for the incumbent to be exposed to various business functions, learning more about the end-to-end supply chain and to make an impact to the business.The position will report to the Purchasing & Supply Chain Manager, Singapore and will be based in Singapore. Close cooperation with the regional supply chain teams is required to maintain proper inventory flows of products, parts and spares and smooth operations overall.
Supply Coordination
Ensure continuous communication on the availability and lead times of products with all stakeholders in the logistics chain in relation to the order at hand, including:
Purchasing & Supply Chain teamsCustomer ServiceWarehouse staffTransport service operators (internal & 3rd party providers)Expeditors (including customs clearance specialists)Continuous follow up on quotes (freight, delivery, duties) and orders with sub-status ‘Awaiting approval’ within the IFS ERP system
Operational Purchasing
Follow up with suppliers in order to meet agreed and confirmed delivery dates; per purchase order and includes updating of purchase orders accordinglySupport Finance when needed on supplier invoice control, hereunder approval of and discrepancies attached to Supplier invoicesPro-actively monitor increase or decrease in demand of products and advise/verify with Purchasing/Supply team members

Inventory Management:

Communicate and cooperate with Purchasing & Supply Planner(s) to ensure availability meets local demand (in scope: mature standard products, for products subject to introduction and end of life-cycle see separate bullets)Support the execution of stock reshuffle, i.e. consolidation of inventories through re-shuffling actions within own Region or recommendations of such when potential is across RegionsSupport the Purchasing & Supply Planner(s) in re-order to inventory, validating results for reasonableness and re-ordering according to defined distribution models and in line with demand and forecasts availableAny other responsibility put forward by Manager from time to otime.

Qualifications:

Diploma/ Degree in any of the following fields: Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Operations Management, Business, Data Analytics, Data Science, Maritime Studies - Professional certification from APICS/ CIPS/ SLA/ SIPMM/ SIMM are also acceptableEntry level candidate or with less than 2 years’ work experience are welcome to applyDemonstrate understanding of supply chain and/or logistics and distribution methodsProven ability to manage different ways of working and managing complexityAbility to influence without formal authorityGood interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work as a team memberGood written and oral skills in EnglishProficiency in one of the following enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, such as SAP, Oracle Netsuite,
Sage or IFS
Knowledge in managing Dangerous Goods (DG) logistics (IATA DGR and/or IMDG) would be highly desirable.Knowledge in continuous improvement methodology and tools

descriptions:
Get to know our Team:
Grab’s Data Science Department works on some of the most challenging and fascinating problems in transport, economics, logistics, and the space around. We apply machine learning, simulation, forecasting, scheduling, optimization, and many other advanced techniques on our huge datasets to push our business metrics to their bounds, directly and indirectly. We foster a culture where we enjoy raising the bar constantly for ourselves and others, and that strongly supports the freedom to explore and innovate.

Get to know the Role:
Report into the Data Science Dept
Explore and extract insights from massive dataset of geospatial, behavioural, economic, and the interaction of millions of passengers and drivers and millions of rides per day from more than 65 cities across the region
Build, validate, test, and deploy machine learning or other data science models to predict and influence the behaviour of supply and demand with the goal of optimising system efficiency of the platform

The day-to-day activities:
Develop creative algorithms by employing machine learning and other data science techniques
Contribute to team’s innovation and IP creation
Collaborate with other data scientists, software engineers, and business operation teams
The must haves:
Ph.D. graduate, or Masters(with at least 3 years of experience), in Computer Science, Economics, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Operations Research, or Mathematics/Statistics
Understanding of machine learning, deep learning, data mining, algorithmic foundations of optimization
Experience with machine learning framework (scikit-learn, Spark MLlib etc)
Proficient in one or more of the following programming languages: Python, R, Scala.
Experience with one or more big data processing frameworks such as Spark
Experience or knowledge in Economics will be advantageous
Self-motivated, independent learner, and willing to share knowledge with team members
Detail-oriented and efficient time manager in a dynamic working environment

Description

Job Purpose:
Citi is a leading global financial services organization with presence in approx. 100 countries around the world.
Citi works tirelessly to provide consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial services and products.
We strive to create the best outcomes for our clients and customers with financial ingenuity that leads to solutions that are simple, creative and responsible.
For our Asia Consumer (GCB) Business we are currently seeking qualified, experienced, dynamic and motivated candidates to be a part of the Asia GCB Data Governance team.
In this role the successful candidate will be responsible for leading and driving end-to-end a critical, regional, multi-year Data Quality Governance initiative and its allied projects.
Job Background / Context:
The Asia GCB Data Governance office has an established and ongoing Data Quality monitoring program that is responsible for Governance and reporting of Critical Data Elements (CDE) for the entire Citi Asia Consumer region spanning 17 countries.
Critical Data Elements are data values identified as having direct impact on our business processes and regulatory reporting. The program monitors the data quality of these CDEs based on a set of rules defined.
The program is undergoing massive scale up to address both regulatory as well as business requirements in terms of CDE coverage.
The program covers all the 17 Citi Asia Consumer markets, its multiple lines of businesses and extensive regulatory reporting.
In order to successfully implement this over the next 2 years, we are looking for skillful, knowledgeable, collaborative, committed, dynamic and responsible candidates having a vast multi-functional background in banking with a keen understanding of the business processes and the regulatory environment.
Position Summary:
The program has 4 critical pillars:
CDE Identification, Mapping and Development of rules
Business User Testing and Acceptance
Implementation
Monitoring , rectification and reporting
Working under the aegis of the GCB Global Data Governance office, this role will be responsible, end-to-end, for all aspects of the pillars stated above
The role includes:
Putting together the CDE requirements of all business teams in a democratic and systematic manner
Building the database of business rules applicable to the CDEs
Executing the rules in the Data Quality Integrated Platform ( DQIP) through rigorous acceptance testing and business sign-offs
Reviewing all CDE rule scores from the scorecards
Publish the scorecards with business counterparts for further analysis and discussion
Engaging with markets in identifying issues on data quality
Remediating the errors by partnering with the data stewards, data owners, operations and technology till closure
Reporting on the program status to Business seniors and sponsors at any given point in time
In the role
Proper documentation of all the CDEs and rules, sign-offs, approvals as auditable artifacts are to be maintained
MIS are to be developed that tracks various aspects of the program including
Reconciliation between business rules and the number of scorecards published
Distribution of CDE scores across red, amber and green percentiles
Ageing of red metrics pending resolution
Disposition of red metrics need to be done through
Performing a first level investigation through data profiling and then engaging with technology Triaging with subject matter experts, business, operations and technology on more complex data issues
Raising the requirement to technology if a fix needs to be implemented and tracking to closure
Ensure that no red metric ages beyond the SLA and the relevant status against the red metric is updated
The role requires constant engagement with Global teams, Asia leadership, business, functions, operations, technology and project teams to resolve issues
The role requires the Governance officer to take complete ownership of any sub-projects arising due to the program and drive it in a similar manner
The primary responsibility is to deliver the solution to the business partners within the agreed timelines and giving constant updates on the progress

Qualifications

Skills Required:
The successful candidate must
Be able to work effectively across a diverse and vast organization using excellent communication and execution skills
Have knowledge of data quality, the related systems and infrastructure
Be knowledgeable about the business process and regulatory requirements governing the financial sector
Have an excellent eye for detail with a desire to get to the root of a problem
Have strong presentation and operational skills including skill with MS Power point and MS excel
Be a good team player
Enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams
Have the ability to work well remotely across different time zones and geographies with a willingness to be flexible till project issues are addressed and solved
Qualifications:
Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in any of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Business
Advanced degree preferred. (Masters or above in fields including but not limited to: Information Systems, Economics, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics)
8+ years of analytical work experience preferred, with a strong understanding of data, databases, data tools (e.g. SAS, SQL, Ab Initio, etc.) and data processing experience
Strong technical understanding of data architecture, data quality and related technologies along with data quality management principles
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience in consumer/retail banking or financial services
Solid working knowledge of core business functions such as quality management, data management, business intelligence, and information technology
Able to work well across multiple functional areas
Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity and to interface with internal and external resources to define requirements
Outstanding analytical and organizational skills with an attention to detail. Tenacity to identify the root cause of problems is essential
Willingness to pitch-in with other team members. Entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to objectively evaluate established business processes, policies and programs
Self-motivated professional with clear and strong “can do” approach
Education:
Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in any of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Business

Amazon Web Services, Inc. ("AWS") enables customers of all sizes to run their applications on Amazon’s industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform. This growth is driving the need for an experienced individual to fill this new, high-profile position as a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst.

Amazon has a strong culture of data-driven decision-making; requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We are looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who is passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making.

In this role, the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst serves as the primary bridge through the business to communicate high value information to support data-driven decision making demands. He/she will continuously evolve management reporting, conduct complex data analysis and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity.

The successful candidate must be able to roll-up his/her sleeves, and work directly with very large datasets and BI tools. He/she will be passionate about their work, detail-oriented, highly analytical and have excellent problem solving skills.

He/she will be passionate about their work, detail-oriented, analytical, and have excellent problem-solving abilities. He/she will be and expert at working with large data sets and the technical tools needed to work with them. He/she will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights; both verbally and in writing; in a clear and precise manner.

Responsibilities
Create, develop and own the APAC BI reporting and analytical environmentCollaborate with the BI Engineer on the design, development and maintenance of data modelsLead the development and provision of BI reporting through the deployment of self-service reports and dashboardsLead the development and provision of advanced analysis through the use of classical statistical and machine driven techniquesMaintain thorough knowledge of existing and emerging open source and proprietary BI and advanced analysis tools

Good working knowledge on Python and Java to create applications and programmesGood understanding of different types of databases and their relevant use casesExperience in conducting data mining studies and employing machine learningExperience working within a high-growth, technology company is highly beneficialAWS certified

Description
Xilinx develops highly flexible and adaptive processing platforms that enable rapid innovation across a variety of technologies - from the endpoint to the edge to the cloud. Xilinx is the inventor of the FPGA, hardware programmable SoCs and the ACAP (Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform), designed to deliver the most dynamic processor technology in the industry and enable the adaptable, intelligent and connected world of the future in a multitude of markets including Data Center (Compute, Storage and Networking); Wireless/5G and Wired Communications; Automotive/ADAS; Emulation & Prototyping; Aerospace & Defense; Industrial Scientific & Medical, and others. Xilinx's core strengths simultaneously address major industry trends including the explosion of data, heterogeneous computing after Moore's Law, and the dawn of artificial intelligence (AI).

We believe that by embracing diverse ideas, striving for excellence in all that we do, and working together as a unified team, we can accomplish anything. Come do your best work and live your best life as part of the ONEXILINX team!

Bachelor degree in Electrical & Electronics / Computer Engineering
Knowledge of PERL scripting, Verilog and Labview automation is desirable
No prior experience required

This role is responsible for using data to develop metrics and analytical insights to enable data-based decision making about our people. There is also standard reporting such as headcount, statutory reporting and attrition on a monthly or scheduled basis.
The incumbent will deliver business-relevant insights about people to support segmented and targeted initiatives that build people capabilities, improve employee engagement, strengthen the AIA culture, and attract and retain the right talent.

Key Responsibilities
Responsible for generating and analyzing data for the following purposes
Insightful information of the workforce so as to empower operational and exploratory analysis and to determine solutions with meaningful impact.
Monitoring key metrics and understanding root causes of changes in the metrics.
Monthly HR dashboard and reports required by business units
Regulatory reporting of people metrics such as headcount, turnover, etc.
Drive yearly budgeting on headcount, company-wide salaries and benefits cost and cost of HR programs.
Work closely with HR Business Partners in understanding and reporting headcount and people movement.
Analyze data to determine best practices of reporting and determine ways to simplify and automate standard reporting.
Identify issues/trends and outliers and form hypothesis/present findings to enable business workforce planning activities.
Provide ad-hoc reporting and analytics support for projects/initiatives
Drive the building of analytics capability building across HR.

Key Requirements
Bachelor degree, preferably in HR or Quantitative discipline, with 5 or more years of HR related experience.
Minimum of 3+ years related workforce analytics and data analysis experience.
Able to conduct data analyses such as regressions, factor analyses, t-tests and ANOVAs
Strong in translating data and analyses into actionable insights and recommendations
Minimum of 3+ years writing and developing HR reports
Strong expertise in Microsoft Excel and Tableau.
Operating knowledge of HRIS is essential
Strong knowledge of HRIS system, Workday preferred
Naturally curious with ability to identify, analyze, and resolve problems logically and systematically as required.
Ability to be self-sufficient, detail-oriented, independent and hands-on

Who we are:
In global markets, buy-side and sell-side professionals strive to achieve the best execution across multiple asset classes. Our Electronic Trading Operations (ETO) team is responsible for ensuring the implementation, stability, and reliability of those offerings.

We implement new connections and detect, analyze, and resolve issues impacting applications and connectivity with clients, vendors, exchanges, brokers, and ATS venues. We ensure seamless performance with our Electronic Trading platforms through interaction with Bloomberg Product areas, Network Operations, Engineering, and Bloomberg's clients. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy, where everyone has a voice - not a job title. Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more important than titles or position.

Bloomberg is so much more than the products and services we deliver to our customers. We use data and analytics to organize, understand and improve our world. We give back - through the vast majority of our profits going to Bloomberg Philanthropies and through our countless volunteer projects. We bring out the best in the communities around us too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else.

Who you are:
You come to work with a purpose. You work fast and hard, understand what urgency means to a trader, are curious and take pride in being customer service driven. You love being part of a team where clients count on you every day, and you challenge and support your colleagues to innovate, learn and deliver the best service possible.

What's the role?

As an Electronic Trading Operations Representative, you're essential in minimizing impact and mitigating financial risk for our clients across their electronic trading solutions. They'll depend on you to ensure a smooth transition process post sale through to solution go-live.

You'll be a key part of our team at the frontline providing specialized technical support and responsible for implementing new electronic trading connections for Bloomberg's clients.

We'll trust you to:
Analyze and troubleshoot issues related to our Electronic Trading products in a production environment

Build and certify new connections, configure applications for these connections, and complete post-production testing

Handle client communication using language appropriate for non-technical users

Prevent production incidents and outages by partnering with Engineering and Product teams to design and implement future system and Product changes

Examine root cause statistics for trends in production issues

Design improvements to existing and new Configuration, Monitoring, and Troubleshooting Support tools

Help prioritize and be responsible for the Product backlog

Conduct capacity planning by analyzing client flows and trading statistics

Help develop metrics for internal consumption and trading system benchmarking

Help design and document trading system recovery procedures

Provide client feedback to the Product team collated through the certification process

Work closely with our clients and our internal Product, Tradedesk, and Engineering groups to facilitate expectations, influence and expedite implementation and resolution of issues

You'll need to have:
4-7+ years working experience in similar application support roles

The ability to support customers effectively in English

A technical curiosity with a passion for customer service and a genuine interest in financial markets

Experience in UNIX and Linux operating systems and commands, troubleshooting LAN / WAN, and in Middleware connectivity (TCP/IP, MQ, UDP)

Exposure to scripting languages, such as Perl, Bash, Korn, and/or Python

Knowledge of Message Protocols; FIX would be a nice to have

Proven history of solving complex problems with a keen eye for detail

A willingness to learn and apply knowledge

Superb communication and client facing skills

An ability to handle your time effectively and multi-task in a fast paced environment

Good project management skills for executing customer driven short term projects and implementation requests

Ability to remain calm working with urgency, multi-task, be a team-player, be client focused, and to adapt in a dynamic changing environment

We'd love to see:
A Computer Science or Technology related degree

Good working product knowledge of Equity, Options, Futures, Fixed Income and FX market workflows and any exposure to Broker/Dealers, Hedge Funds and Regulatory Reporting requirements

The ability to support customers effectively in Mandarin

Experience with SQL or transactional databases and operating large structured and un-structured datasets (such as indexed data and delimited complex system logs)

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/ .

Bloomberg is an equal opportunities employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Prudential, we understand that success comes from the talent and commitment of our people. Together, we have a shared vision in securing the future of our customers and our communities. We strive to build a business that you can shape, an inclusive workplace where everyone’s ideas are valued and a culture where we can thrive together. Our people stay connected and tuned in to what’s happening around us, keeping us ahead of the curve. While focused on the long-term, we look to the future to bring growth, development and benefit to everyone whose lives we touch.

job_titles: Chief Customer Technology Advisor | APAC | Singapore Location
descriptions:
Job Category
Sales
Job Details

The role of Chief Customer Technology Advisor (CCTA) is a customer-facing role aligned to work with our most strategic customers and prospects on digital transformations, business architecture and enterprise architecture. Working along-side the sales account team, you will be required to help customers translate their business strategy into a technology vision and roadmap to deliver on their stated business outcomes. This will require previous Enterprise Architecture experience and an ability to advise customers on digital transformation, customer experience and cloud adoption. In addition, this role requires the ability to bring together a broad vision for our customers, as well as define an architecture strategy and roadmap for their adoption of Salesforce.


This position requires a senior individual with a strong blend of digital transformation, business, enterprise architecture and consultative skills. It is an expectation of the role that this individual will be able to build and maintain senior executive relationships.


Key Responsibilities

- Architecture & Strategy leadership - You will be aligned to a set of strategic accounts and required to own the architecture vision and strategy.

In collaboration with the sales account team, you will be required to support account and opportunity planning.
Become a trusted advisor to CIO/CTO/EA level contacts and their teams as they look to transform their business
Knowledge and ability to articulate key concepts in digital transformation, customer experience and cloud adoption.
Understand the customer’s business strategy and technology needs; identifying the key capabilities and technology enablers required to support these.
Lead specific enterprise architecture engagements in key accounts.
Be accountable for the development of business case documents, visioning proposals, enterprise architecture artefacts, delivery roadmaps and executive presentations.
Work within a matrix-style organisation, working across multiple teams and stakeholders.
Mentor and guide sales and pre-sales resources on strategic opportunities.
Participation in the delivery of solution best practices, reference architectures, educational sessions and industry summits to existing customers, partners and to internal audiences.

Required Experience/Skills


B.S. Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent work experience
Experience in enterprise architecture principles and tools
Multi-year experience in either a software vendor or enterprise architecture disciplines
Proven experience in creating, selling or implementing technology-based solutions
Ability to communicate the business value of technology decisions
Good understanding of the architectural principles of cloud based platforms including SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenant, multi-tiered infrastructure.
Experience with working within the Government sector.
Key experience in Digital Transformation and Business Architecture

Desired Skills


Familiarity with solution selling or equivalent Sales Methodologies
Familiarity with design thinking and or similar frameworks
Previous experience in IT Strategy or planning
Experience of architectural frameworks such as TOGAF or equivalent.
Familiarity with relevant (regional, vertical,) data privacy, security and compliance requirements for Cloud

About Salesforce


Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work for six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win.

*LI-Y CWOOD
"Digital Transformation", "Business Architecture" "Enterprise Architecture"

job_titles: Director, Ethics & Compliance for Third Party Management, Growth& Emerging Markets
descriptions:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.
Job Description
Ethics & Compliance (E&C) focuses on what the organization needs by ensuring
Ethical behaviour plays a fundamental role in risk mitigation
Being a forward-thinking leader in risk identification and mitigation
Building a modern function supporting achievement of Takeda’s Vision 2025
E&C will respond rapidly to changing environment and business needs, it is close to the market, and encourages ethical behaviour in line with Takeda’s values. By working in an agile manner E&C ensures the balance between stable structures, governance, processes and systems, and dynamic approaches to delivering innovative solutions to appropriately manage our risks.
E&C commits to
Act as role model for Takeda's values, ethics and values-based decision making, fostering this mindset in clients, partners and team
Enable the organization to take decisions which are ethical and in line with our priorities of Patient, Trust, Reputation, and Business
Collaborate across all E&C teams and partner with stakeholders in BU / BF to embed ethics and compliance as part of the way everyone works at Takeda
RESPONSIBILITIES
Act as primary Subject Matter Expert for all of Takeda globally, provide guidance on strategic third-party management including anti-corruption.
Implement an effective third-party management program, providing guidance and support around lifecycle management of our third-party business partners; including 1) Selection & Evaluation 2) Contracting and On-boarding 3) Managing and monitoring 4) Off-boarding and termination.
Implement, monitor and continuously improve policies and procedures to identify and manage third party risk including anti-corruption risks.
Develop and drive the implementation of an effective training program for employees and third parties.
Work closely with Region, Area and LOC Ethics and Compliance Officers and business leaders globally to address third party risks including corruption risks.
Proactively identify emerging third-party regulatory issues, developments in industry practices and standards, and related Compliance risk trends and use appropriate tools, policies and procedures
Lead all third party Compliance-related reports, presentations and other communications for employees and senior management globally
CAPABILITIES
Acts as role model for Takeda’s values, ethics and values-based decision making
High interpersonal and communication skills including ability to challenge and provide advice/ guidance to business
Ability to lead across a diverse, multi-cultural environment with complex business operations.
Personal and professional maturity, able to motivate and inspire.
Leading and influencing with and without authority, including cross-functional projects
Solution oriented strategic partner with a hands-on mind set
Ability to build strong relationships with key stakeholders
Capable of leading, managing and prioritizing multiple tasks and objectives
Managing complexity and ambiguity: ability to develop and apply pragmatic solutions to complex legal, regulatory and industry issues
Mindset of curiosity, learning agility and interest in innovative ways of doing things
Combines enterprise thinking and business focus
Strong operations, process-orientation, data analytics, or technical expertise to effectively design, develop and implement compliance and relevant business processes, controls, and workflows
EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree, relevant advanced degree is preferred
Proven experience in commercial business roles preferably managing third parties (minimum 10 years)
Experience in working in emerging markets across different cultures, regulatory and legal frameworks.
Experience working in global environment without having formal authority
Strong business acumen and ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders
Experience of Third Party Risk Management.
Demonstrated knowledge of key laws, regulations and industry best practice standards
Experience in managing potential, present and future compliance risks related to the business, including risk identification, controls & risk mitigation of potential non-compliance
Experience in using ethical decision making.

Singapore, Singapore

Employee

Regional Comp & Benefits Mgr | Singapore
 - (19002376)

Manage the development and delivery of Compensation and Benefits (C&B) policy and practice across assigned region to meet the needs of the business. Close liaison with the Total Rewards team and the broader regional team, Payroll, Talent Acquisition and Finance functions in the assigned region. Supports the company in the assigned region on global initiatives and administration, such as annual merit planning and cycle, bonus participation and administration, and benefits support.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

 Managing positive relationships with the business and ensuring the reputation and regard for HR is strong with all stakeholders.

 Ensuring all C&B policies and practices are legally compliant across the region and in line with business strategy and aims.

 Analyze C&B for the region through appropriate market evaluation on both a periodic and ad hoc basis. Partnering with HR colleagues and the business to develop and deliver business cases for change as required.

 Participate in C&B surveys as assigned.

 Conduct periodic analysis of appropriate tools (e.g. salary range data, job coding, salary banding) to ensure the recruitment and HR teams are always in possession of accurate and useable information to support the business.

 Managing annual and ad hoc salary review, mandated increases, signing bonuses and bonus payments with HR colleagues and the business.
 Managing relationships with local benefit vendors to ensure best value for the business.

 Supports merger and acquisition (M&A) work as required.
 Ensuring that enquires from employees and managers are handled promptly and effectively and escalated to HR colleagues when required or directed to other teams (e.g. Payroll and Talent Acquisition).

 Facilitate quality and accuracy of data on shared systems such as PeopleSoft.

 Collecting, reporting and acting on relevant Management Information as needed in the region.

 Contributing to HR projects across the region and internationally.

 Coordinate application of C&B policies and practices in line with regulation, best practice and the HR and business strategy.

 Responsible for ongoing training as C&B to improve managers’ understanding and use of C&B.


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS (please indicate if ‘preferred’)

 Significant, progressive experience in related C&B areas
 Prior experience working with benefit vendors
 Working knowledge of Microsoft products - - especially excel
 Strong communication and collaboration skills

Years of experience required: 5 years of progressive compensation & benefits experience

Who we are:
In global markets, buy-side and sell-side professionals strive to achieve the best execution across multiple asset classes. Our Electronic Trading Operations (ETO) team is responsible for ensuring the implementation, stability, and reliability of those offerings.

We implement new connections and detect, analyze, and resolve issues impacting applications and connectivity with clients, vendors, exchanges, brokers, and ATS venues. We ensure seamless performance with our Electronic Trading platforms through interaction with Bloomberg Product areas, Network Operations, Engineering, and Bloomberg's clients. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy, where everyone has a voice - not a job title. Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more important than titles or position.

Bloomberg is so much more than the products and services we deliver to our customers. We use data and analytics to organize, understand and improve our world. We give back - through the vast majority of our profits going to Bloomberg Philanthropies and through our countless volunteer projects. We bring out the best in the communities around us too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else.

Who you are:
You come to work with a purpose. You work fast and hard, understand what urgency means to a trader, are curious and take pride in being customer service driven. You love being part of a team where clients count on you every day, and you challenge and support your colleagues to innovate, learn and deliver the best service possible.

What's the role?

As an Electronic Trading Operations Representative, you're essential in minimizing impact and mitigating financial risk for our clients across their electronic trading solutions. They'll depend on you to ensure a smooth transition process post sale through to solution go-live.

You'll be a key part of our team at the frontline providing specialized technical support and responsible for implementing new electronic trading connections for Bloomberg's clients.

We'll trust you to:
Analyze and troubleshoot issues related to our Electronic Trading products in a production environment

Build and certify new connections, configure applications for these connections, and complete post-production testing

Handle client communication using language appropriate for non-technical users

Prevent production incidents and outages by partnering with Engineering and Product teams to design and implement future system and Product changes

Examine root cause statistics for trends in production issues

Design improvements to existing and new Configuration, Monitoring, and Troubleshooting Support tools

Help prioritize and be responsible for the Product backlog

Conduct capacity planning by analyzing client flows and trading statistics

Help develop metrics for internal consumption and trading system benchmarking

Help design and document trading system recovery procedures

Provide client feedback to the Product team collated through the certification process

Work closely with our clients and our internal Product, Tradedesk, and Engineering groups to facilitate expectations, influence and expedite implementation and resolution of issues

You'll need to have:
4-7+ years working experience in similar application support roles

The ability to support customers effectively in English

A technical curiosity with a passion for customer service and a genuine interest in financial markets

Experience in UNIX and Linux operating systems and commands, troubleshooting LAN / WAN, and in Middleware connectivity (TCP/IP, MQ, UDP)

Exposure to scripting languages, such as Perl, Bash, Korn, and/or Python

Knowledge of Message Protocols; FIX would be a nice to have

Proven history of solving complex problems with a keen eye for detail

A willingness to learn and apply knowledge

Superb communication and client facing skills

An ability to handle your time effectively and multi-task in a fast paced environment

Good project management skills for executing customer driven short term projects and implementation requests

Ability to remain calm working with urgency, multi-task, be a team-player, be client focused, and to adapt in a dynamic changing environment

We'd love to see:
A Computer Science or Technology related degree

Good working product knowledge of Equity, Options, Futures, Fixed Income and FX market workflows and any exposure to Broker/Dealers, Hedge Funds and Regulatory Reporting requirements

The ability to support customers effectively in Mandarin

Experience with SQL or transactional databases and operating large structured and un-structured datasets (such as indexed data and delimited complex system logs)

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/ .

Bloomberg is an equal opportunities employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Dell Technologies is built on the combined capabilities Dell, EMC, Pivotal, RSA, SecureWorks, Virtustream and VMware. Together, the company has a combined annual revenue of $74 billion, 20,000 patents and patents applications and 140,000 employees worldwide in 180 locations. Companies under the umbrella of Dell Technologies are all leaders in their respective areas. Dell is #1 for PC shipments in US, EMC is #1 for x86 virtualization software worldwide and VMware is #1 for cloud system management software.
Besides a market leader, Dell is renowned for its supply chain innovation and is consistently recognized as having one of the top five supply chains in the world. Yet, changes in the industry and the internal organization require us to constantly redesign our supply chain to optimize customer experience, efficiency and risk mitigation.
Global Operations Strategy team reports to the Chief Supply Chain Officer and is responsible for designing and implementing advance supply chains across Dell’s lines of business. The team in Singapore consists of high-profile members who were ex-consultants from McKinsey, BCG and A.T. Kearney and alumni from Harvard, MIT, INSEAD, Yale and Princeton.
Description of Position
As an analyst in our Global Operations Strategy organization, you will have the opportunity to contribute to projects such as global operations footprint design, supply chain optimization, procurement strategy and the management of innovation and technology in the supply chain. Working as a team, you are expected to aid Dell’s executives to drive key business decision. As part of an incubator of future leaders at the company, you will be developed with the end goal of moving on to a leadership role within the organization.
The position offers:
Opportunity to drive cutting-edge strategies for one of the industry’s top supply chains
Access to executive leadership team at a Fortune 50 company
Opportunity to work with a highly motivated team that invests in your development
A commitment to diversity and inclusion
Competitive compensation including bonus plans & a great benefit package
Requirements
Key skills include:
Support business strategy development
Distinctive problem solving and analytical thinking
Conduct data analysis and bench-marking
Effective project and change management skills
Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s or Master degree in related field
Supply Chain or procurement experience helpful, though not necessary

The Programme in Health Services and Systems Research, Duke-NUS Medical School, Singapore is looking for candidates with either undergraduate or masters training in economics or related disciplines to support our growing portfolio of econometric/statistical analysis and decision analytic modelling projects.
This position will report directly to Senior Health Economists in the Health Economics Lab and offers an excellent opportunity to develop and refine in demand skills in applied health economics. Successful candidates will assist in high value health economic research endeavours and perform a variety of functions, such as:
Execute econometric and other statistical analyses
Build decision trees and markov models for use in cost effectiveness analyses
Conduct literature reviews
Prepare sections of surveys, analysis plans, manuscripts, reports and grant proposals with a goal toward producing high quality research outputs
Perform other related duties assigned by the Principal Investigators in support of these efforts
Many previous RA’s have been listed as co-authors on peer-reviewed manuscripts and gone on to secure positions in top international graduate programs and Fortune 500 companies. Interested applicants should submit a cover letter explaining their interest in the position, a resume, and a writing sample to hr@duke-nus.edu.sg.
Qualifications

Job Requirements
Masters or Bachelor’s Degree in Economics
Research experience in Health Economics and Econometrics highly desirable
Experience in quantitative data and statistical analyses (preferably with health-economic data) with modelling packages such as STATA
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite required
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Able to multi-task and work productively in teams, under the supervision of senior staff
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Singapore-Singapore-Singapore | Full-time | Corporate Functions | Job ID 130611

Credit Suisse’s Experienced and Campus Recruitment team are recruitment experts and Credit Suisse brand ambassadors, who strategically partner with the business to solve recruitment challenges, provide direction as a control function and make valuable contributions to hiring processes. This support is end to end from planning through execution and across levels from entry level to executive hiring.
We connect Credit Suisse with passionate and talented people, who deliver results and embody our culture.


We pride ourselves in our ability to deliver in a dynamic and engaging environment. We are committed to investing and developing our people and building opportunities for growth and progression.


You will be a member of the Experienced and Campus Recruitment team, responsible for creatively identifying and engaging top talent, while improving and contributing to the employer brand and scaling our recruitment practice as we grow our organization. You will partner with our Divisional / Function Leadership team to attract and hire extraordinary talent into the firm.
This role reports into the Experienced Recruitment Team Lead based in Singapore and will cover Experienced hires across the APAC region. You will be part of a broader team based in Singapore, Hong Kong and Pune, covering APAC Division, Front Office and Corporate Functions.


The team in APAC is supported by centralized global services providing administrative and interview scheduling assistance enabling you to focus on delivering a consultative service to your client group and developing deep subject matter knowledge.


About the role
Your responsibilities will include:

developing and maintaining strong working relationships with the executive leadership team, external search partners, agencies & diversity experts where appropriate, candidate and external community organizations to build a partnership that yields success, trust and credibility
providing advice and direction to hiring managers and candidates about the entire hiring process, building those relationships effectively being a trusted advisor to both the business and candidates
conducting thorough intake sessions to understand the business requirements and translate into a solution based recruiting strategy; develop an engaging value proposition that can be communicated to the candidates to sell the opportunities of the role and Credit Suisse
crafting sourcing strategies that tap into internal talent pools, diverse markets and external matches; actively providing qualified internal prospects and ensuring cost effective sourcing channels
providing solutions, including assessment recommendations to narrow the candidate pools to find the best CS fit and structured interviews expertise to support objective candidate feedback
providing counsel to hiring managers on compensation in line with salary bands, peer ranges, market data and direct peer comparisons and actively participating in the hiring decision process by providing feedback on candidates and recommendation for hire
ensuring effective candidate management providing detailed review of role, overview of compensation & benefits, key messages, resignation coaching and assisting with closing
continually assess and measure our delivery and adjust the strategy accordingly
providing training, knowledge sharing, coaching and mentoring as a recruitment subject matter authority
operating within our Conduct & Ethic standards, be aware of operational risk, raising when any identified with a focus on striving for operational excellence and working with the wider team on constant improvement.


*LI-CSJOB*


To be successful in this role you will have:

passion about delivering the best results for Credit Suisse
significant hands-on in-house recruitment experience recruiting banking professionals
understanding of the local market and country rules & regulations as they relate to recruitment
excellent organizational, written and verbal interpersonal skills with a sincere commitment to regular communication with your hiring managers
high level of integrity, sense of urgency, attention to detail and quality standards – with the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines effectively
Demonstrable relationship building, influence, negotiation and consultation skills with a track record in closing candidates

The Senior/Total Rewards Specialist supports the SEA Rewards function for the region in the implementation and on-going success of the company’s rewards programs. The Senior/Total Rewards Specialist is responsible for supporting the local HR on the development, integration, implementation, and in partnership, communication of APAC reward programs for approximately 1,900+ employees in SEA

Duties and Responsibilities:
1. Support SEA Rewards Manager and with Corporate Global Compensation and Global Benefits counterparts in the innovative design, implementation, and management of compensation programs and initiatives which include base and variable pay programs and benefits programs including health care, group and retirement plans

2. Works closely with regional HR team and Total Rewards Center of Excellence (COE) team to ensure that compensation and benefits programs are competitive and aligned with the global compensation framework (providing consulting on senior level hires, incentive plan design, position and pay program evaluation and benchmarking) and global benefits strategy

3. Develop partnerships with the HR business partners, business leadership and Talent Acquisition teams to identify and solve compensation related business challenges and provide compensation consulting expertise

4. Support the development, alignment and administration of base pay strategies, policies and programs including: job evaluation, market pricing, salary surveys, salary structure and increase recommendations

5. Support job classification and career banding for the region as well as integration of newly acquired employees

8. Assist HR Service Delivery Partners in SEA to develop best practices and provide superior compensation services to our clients

9. Conduct research, identify benchmark resources, analyze data and identify trends in the region requiring a broad understanding of compensation techniques, methods, and practices and recommend business solutions

10. Ensure all compensation and benefits programs and practices are in compliance with regulatory requirements, providing recommendation as new regulations are enacted

11. Seek to continuously improve link between pay and performance through program improvement and communication/education

12. Stay abreast of current compensation and benefits trends and best practices and continually review against current practices, procedures and systems

13. Other duties as assigned or required, will work on APAC-wide initiatives, executive compensation or other global compensation or global benefits initiatives

 - (19002376)

Manage the development and delivery of Compensation and Benefits (C&B) policy and practice across assigned region to meet the needs of the business. Close liaison with the Total Rewards team and the broader regional team, Payroll, Talent Acquisition and Finance functions in the assigned region. Supports the company in the assigned region on global initiatives and administration, such as annual merit planning and cycle, bonus participation and administration, and benefits support.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

 Managing positive relationships with the business and ensuring the reputation and regard for HR is strong with all stakeholders.

 Ensuring all C&B policies and practices are legally compliant across the region and in line with business strategy and aims.

 Conduct periodic analysis of appropriate tools (e.g. salary range data, job coding, salary banding) to ensure the recruitment and HR teams are always in possession of accurate and useable information to support the business.

 Supports merger and acquisition (M&A) work as required.

 Collecting, reporting and acting on relevant Management Information as needed in the region.

 Contributing to HR projects across the region and internationally.

 Responsible for ongoing training as C&B to improve managers’ understanding and use of C&B.


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS (please indicate if ‘preferred’)

 Significant, progressive experience in related C&B areas
 Prior experience working with benefit vendors
 Working knowledge of Microsoft products - - especially excel
 Strong communication and collaboration skills

Years of experience required: 5 years of progressive compensation & benefits experience
